sen.j: 南観音山（みなみかんのんやま）は、毎年7月17日に京都市内で行われる祇園祭にて巡行する「山鉾」のひとつ。
sen.e: "Minamikannon yama" is one of "yamahoko" (decorative floats) parading in Gion festival in Kyoto on July 17 every year.

sen.j: 全32の山鉾のうち、最後に巡行する曳山。
sen.e: It is the rearmost "hikiyama" (a float dragged by people) parading at the end of the procession of thirty two yamahoko.

sen.e: It has been preserved and operated mainly by the foundation Minamikannon yama Hozonkai.

sen.j: 南観音山の御神体は楊柳観音と善財童子である。
sen.e: Principal images of Minamikannon-yama are Yoryu Kannon (the Goddess of Mercy) and Zenzai Doji (a child of wealth.)

sen.j: 楊柳観音像は恵心僧都源信 (僧侶)（942年 - 1017年）の作と伝承するが、天明の大火（1788年）で像の頭部以外は焼失してしまったため、復元されたものである。
sen.e: According to legend, the image of Yoryu Kannon was carved by Eshin Sozu Genshin (a priest) (942 - 1017,) but since its body except head portion was destroyed by conflagration in 1788, the present image was made as the restoration of the original image.

sen.j: 楊柳観音の横で合掌している善財童子像は江戸時代の作。
sen.e: The image of Zenzai Doji, joining his hands in prayer beside Yoryu Kannon, was worked out in the Edo Period.

sen.j: 華厳経「入法界品（にゅうほっかいぼん）」にある、善財童子が53名の善知識を歴訪するという説話から取材されている。
sen.e: These images are taken from a narrative about Zenzai Doji in the Chapter "Nyuhokkai-bon" of Kegon-kyo (Avatamska Sutra,) who made a tour to visit fifty three zen-chishiki (a person who offers spiritual friendship and guidance to visitors.)

sen.j: 南観音山だけに存在する行事、「あばれ観音」は、宵山と呼ばれる、山鉾巡行の前日16日の深夜におこなわれる。
sen.e: "Abare Kannon" (literally, rampaging kannon,) which is an unique event of Minami Kannon yama, is also called "Yoiyama" and held at midnight of July 16 before the day of procession of decorated floats.

sen.j: 御神体の楊柳観音を神輿にくくりつけて揺らしながら、保存会がある町内を3周するというものである。
sen.e: In this event, people bind up a principal image Yoryu Kannon onto a sacred palanquin, and carry it swinging around the town of Hozonkai three times.

sen.j: 「暴れさせることで北観音山の観音さまへの恋心を冷めさせる」とのいわれがある。
sen.e: By this violent swinging actions, people are said they are trying to cool down Yoryu Kannon's feeling of love toward another kannon bodhisattva living in Kitakannon yama.

sen.j: 見送りの「龍王渡海図」（1988年新調）・下水引の「飛天奏楽」（1995年新調）は、日本画家の加山又造の下絵によるもの。
sen.e: It was Matazo KAYAMA, a Japanese-style painter who designed "Ryuotokaizu" (literally, a picture of dragon crossing over the sea,) a pattern on miokuri (a backside drop curtain of a float) which was renewed in 1988, and "Hitensogaku" (literally, flying music,) a pattern on shita-mizuhiki (a lower side-drapery of a float) which was renewed in 1995.
